main.name: Abhishek Kumar
main.description: I Love to Design new things and solving problems.
main.bio: I experiment lot of things and get better at few of those. I Love to design new things and solving problems. Graduated as Mechanical engineer, but my curiosity toward how Information works forced me to learn Programming like c and c++, and from there my journey started, and since 2016 from C language, now as UI develope It has been 5+ years of journey. Have helped various startup to transform their idea into digital product. My objective is to RECOGNISE the business need and understand CUSTOMER and TRANSLATE requirements into design, prototype and then into live PRODUCT.

work.title: Software Engineer
description: Responsible for Front End UI and Marketing page using Gatsby and react js.
Creating Test case to validate UI using cypress.
Making SEO friendly web pages to rank in search engine.
Used material UI and styled component to handle styling.
Backend Headless CMS contentfull and and for query used Graph QL.
Used Storybook for UI documentation.

work.title: Co-Founder & Web Engineer
description: Responsible to Design, Develop, Test and Deploy Digital product.
Design E-commerce UI from scratch using Figma.
Used React.js for front end and redux for state management.
Recruited and lead a team of 8 Web.
Designed and revamped the entire web presence.
Leading the internship program with more than 22 interns.
Analyzed the needs operations team and automated their processes.

work.title: Web Developer
description: Creating custom them for Wordpress.
Creating dynamic pages using Javascript and handling servers.
Developed Email filter tool to help Email marketing team so that they can reduce spam rate.
Created Email marketing tool to scale over transactions worth more than millions of dollars.

work.title: Web Dev Intern
description: Creating Basic static web pages.
Making Emailer campaign for marketing team.
Worked very closely with marketing team.
Learning how to Work with Wordpress and created multiple blog website.
